author: dlr
msg: Fix a bug where the svn:eol-style property could be set to a bogus
value (e.g. via propset/propedit), with annoying repercussions.
Originally reported against TortoiseSVN at
<http://tortoisesvn.tigris.org/servlets/ReadMsg?list=users&msgNo=8535>:
"When somebody went to switch from trunk to a tag (the tag did not
have the property), SVN failed at the point that it tried to remove
the property from their working copy (the error was something like
"invalid eol-style").  So I removed this property from trunk, got
the user to manually remove the property from their working copy and
then they could switch successfully (the property is just merged
away at that point)."
But then things got much worse.  Now anyone on trunk who tries to
update to the head revision is faced with the same error.  The
work-around of course is that they must all manually delete this
property."
Subsequently reported against Subversion's own libraries at
<http://subversion.tigris.org/servlets/ReadMsg?list=dev&msgNo=133402>.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/props.c
(svn_wc_canonicalize_svn_prop): Error out if the value of the
svn:eol-style property is set, but isn't recognized.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/prop_tests.py
(inappropriate_props): Extend test to check that an invalid value
for the svn:eol-style property results in an error.
Found by: Dave Lawrence <dlawrence@ad-holdings.co.uk>
Stefan Kueng <tortoisesvn@gmail.com>
Reviewed by: Stefan Kueng <tortoisesvn@gmail.com>
sussman
ehu
glasser

author: pburba
msg: Fix bug in merge notifications involving deletions/replacements.
Previously, when a merge deleted a path the deletion notification(s) came
before the "--- Merging*" | "--- Reverse-merging*" headers.  This change
ensures the header always shows first.
A beneficial side-effect of this change is that merge delete and replacement
notifications are now akin to those from update -- Specifically, if a
directory is deleted we no longer report on every child under that directory
as deleted too.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(merge_dir_deleted): Pass NULL notify function/baton to
svn_client__wc_delete(), instead let repos_diff.c:delete_entry() do the
notifications.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py
(delete_file_and_dir, merge_dir_replace):
* subversion/tests/cmdline/revert_tests.py
(status_of_missing_dir_after_revert_replaced_with_history_dir):
Tweak expected merge output to reflect changes above.

author: cmpilato
msg: Fix a buglet in the test suite's mergeinfo parser trigged when a line
of output head a prefix but no value.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/parsers.py
(STATE_TOKENS): Don't treat the space-after-colon as part of the token.
(parse_next): Advance past the space-after-colon when grabbing the value.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/mergeinfo_tests.py
(test_list): No longer expect explicit_mergeinfo_source() to fail.

author: cmpilato
msg: For issue #2820, add to 'svn mergeinfo' the ability to query merge
info/availability for a single explicit source URL.
* subversion/svn/cl.h
(svn_cl__from_source_opt): New enum value.
(svn_cl__opt_state_t): Add 'from_source' member.
* subversion/svn/mergeinfo-cmd.c
(show_mergeinfo_for_source): New helper.
(svn_cl__mergeinfo): If --from-source is provided, only show output
for a particular merge source (whether or not any merges have been
made from that source); otherwise, show all info for prior merge
sources (as before).
* subversion/svn/main.c
(svn_cl__options): Add info for the --from-source option.
(svn_cl__cmd_table): Add --from-source support to the mergeinfo command.
(main): Add handling for the --from-source option.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/mergeinfo_tests.py
(explicit_mergeinfo_source): New.
(test_list): Add refererence to new test, XFail() because of what
appears to be a bug in the test suite itself.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/parsers.py
(MergeinfoReportParser): Tweak comment to fix indentation of sample
mergeinfo output.
